{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the provided documents, infant mortality rate is defined as the number of deaths under 1 year of age to total live births per 1000 live births per year. This is evident from the study 'Infantile mortality in Cuba; analysis of a program for its reduction (1970-1976)' which reports infant mortality rates as per thousand live births. Similarly, other studies such as 'Sudden infant death syndrome: factors contributing to the difference in incidence between Victoria and Tasmania' and 'Falling incidence of hypoxic-ischaemic encephalopathy in term infants' also report infant mortality rates in a similar manner.", "answer_choice": A}
